intro: Anthacanthus jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican anthacanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
